results.question: How much is the Part B premium in 2025?
results.answer:
The Part B premium in 2025 is $185 per month for most people. [1]

**Summary** [2]
• The standard Part B monthly premium amount is $185 in 2025 [3]
• Most people pay this standard premium amount [4]

**Edge cases** [1]
• Higher-income individuals may pay an additional Income-Related Monthly Adjustment Amount (IRMAA) [2]
• IRMAA applies if 2023 modified adjusted gross income was above $106,000 (individual) or $212,000 (married filing jointly) [3]
• Some people with limited income and resources may qualify for programs to help pay premiums [4]

The context provides clear information on the 2025 Part B premium. It states multiple times that the standard amount is $185 per month. However, it's important to note that higher-income beneficiaries may pay more due to IRMAA, while those with limited resources may qualify for assistance programs. [1]

results.question: Do I pay IRMAA in 2025 if my income is $110,000?
results.answer:
Yes — you will pay an IRMAA (Income-Related Monthly Adjustment Amount) in 2025 if your income is $110,000. [1]

**Summary** [2]
• For individual filers with income above $106,000 up to $133,000, you pay $259.00 per month for Part B in 2025 [3]
• This includes the standard premium of $185.00 plus an IRMAA of $74.00 [4]

**Edge cases** [1]
• Different thresholds apply for joint filers and married filing separately [2]
• Late enrollment penalties may increase these amounts [3]
• IRMAA is based on your income from 2 years prior (2023 for 2025 premiums) [4]

The context shows that individuals with yearly income above $106,000 up to $133,000 in 2023 will pay $259.00 per month for Part B in 2025. This is $74.00 more than the standard premium of $185.00, representing the IRMAA. With an income of $110,000, you fall into this bracket and will therefore be subject to IRMAA in 2025. [1]
